types1:Item.types1:Name: PurchaseOrderSvcCn
types1:Item.types1:Description: This synchronous inbound service enables you to create, update, and delete purchase orders with the data provided in a payload. It is based on the OData protocol and can be consumed in Fiori apps and on other user interfaces.

businessConnector.name: PurchaseOrderSvcCn
businessConnector.description: This synchronous inbound service enables you to create, update, and delete purchase orders with the data provided in a payload. It is based on the OData protocol and can be consumed in Fiori apps and on other user interfaces.

parameter.description: Purchasing Document Number Alphanumeric key uniquely identifying the document.
parameter.label: PurchaseOrderPathParam
parameter.name: PurchaseOrderPathParam

parameter.description: Item Number of Purchasing Document Specifies the number that uniquely identifies an item in .
parameter.label: PurchaseOrderItemPathParam
parameter.name: PurchaseOrderItemPathParam

parameter.description: Number of the Document Condition The internal number under which the system saves conditions that apply to a sales order, for example. The purchasing and sales departments may want to use the same order number for a document even though different conditions may apply in each area. The system uses the internal number to identify the different conditions.
parameter.label: PricingDocumentPathParam
parameter.name: PricingDocumentPathParam

parameter.description: Condition item number The number that uniquely identifies the condition item. The condition item number corresponds to the number in the originating document. For example, if the condition applies to a sales order, the condition item number corresponds to the item number in the sales order.
parameter.label: PricingDocumentItemPathParam
parameter.name: PricingDocumentItemPathParam

parameter.description: Number that determines the sequence of the condition within a procedure.
parameter.label: PricingProcedureStepPathParam
parameter.name: PricingProcedureStepPathParam

parameter.description: Condition Counter Access number of the conditions within a step in the pricing procedure. During automatic pricing, the system takes into account the sequence specified by the counter.
parameter.label: PricingProcedureCounterPathParam
parameter.name: PricingProcedureCounterPathParam
